questions.question_text: Which of the following commands allow an administrator to determine if the current system is a virtual machine?

A Linux administrator is developing a Bash script to close specific ports on a server firewall. The administrator is not certain of the default port for the Internet
Message Access Protocol.
Which of the following files should the administrator check to determine the default port?

When logging in, an administrator must use a temporary six-digit code that is displayed on a key fob.
Which of the following has been implemented?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B:
The HOTP algorithm uses the HMAC algorithm to generate authentication codes. To do so, HOTP hashes a cryptographic key and a counter, which is the data here, twice to produce the code. Here, the cryptographic key is shared between the system and the device. The counter is separately maintained by both the token device and the system.
The answer is B ::1 is IPv6 equivalent of 127.0.0.1 in IPv4

questions.question_text:
A junior Linux administrator is updating local name resolution to support IPv6. The administrator issues the command cat /etc/hosts and receives the following output:
127.0.0.1 localhost
Which of the following actions should the administrator perform to accomplish this task?

choices.A: Modify the /etc/hosts file, and add the ipv6 localhost entry to the file.
choices.C: Modify the /etc/hosts file, and add the ipv4 localhost entry to the file.
choices.B: Modify the /etc/hosts file, and add the ::1 localhost entry to the file.
choices.D: Modify the /etc/hosts file, and add the 0.0.0.0 localhost entry to the file.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A is correct. You need the z to apply the compression

Selected Answer: A
is A but there you have to correctit, should be "tar -cvf backup.tar.gz /employee"

questions.question_text:
A directory called /employee is shared with many employees in a company. New hardware was acquired, and the systems administrator needs to back up all files in /employee before the server is replaced.
Which of the following commands should be used to back up all the files and compress them to use little space in the filesystem?
